alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 28 at 2:24PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 400 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain and isolated thunderstorms over the Kona slopes and the saddle road. Rain was falling at a rate of up to 2 inches per hour. Additional heavy showers will be possible over the Kona and south Kohala districts through the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kailua-Kona, Captain Cook, Waikoloa Village, Honalo, Kainaliu, Pohakuloa Training Area, Kealakekua, Honaunau, Holualoa, Kahaluu-Keauhou, Puuanahulu, Pohakuloa Camp, Kalaoa, Waikii, Kona International Airport, Waikoloa Beach and Hawaii Volcanoes Park Kahuku Unit. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 400 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action.
